title: Coronation Street SPOILER: Skins actor Liam Boyle set to join the cast
text:
As the troubled younger brother of Rachel Bailey, played by Suranne Jones, in ITV crime drama Scott & Bailey, he is no stranger to playing a criminal.

And now Liam Boyle will join the cast of Coronation Street in a dramatic story line.

The British actor, 34, will play hardened criminal Abe Crowley, David Platt's cellmate, in the soap's next big narrative development.

Hardened criminal: Liam Boyle (pictured right with David Platt) will join the cast of Coronation Street in a dramatic story line

The Bolton-born actor previously starred alongside Jack O'Connell as evil gangster Louie in Skins' spin-off Rise.

In a picture released by ITV, Liam holds a pair of scissors out towards a concerned-looking David, played by Jack P Shepherd.

The pair already became friendly in the soap after David distracted a guard to stop him discovering Abe's phone.

Gangster: The Bolton-born actor previously starred alongside Jack O'Connell as evil gangster Louie in Skins' spin-off Rise

And in his Coronation Street debut, spoilers have revealed David will retreat to his cell during a prison riot but be surprised by the appearance of Abe dragging a terrified Josh Tucker behind him.

It comes after David was drugged and raped by Josh, played by Ryan Clayton, during a lads' night out in March 2018.

In the upcoming story line David's family will watch the news as the riots unfold and David will tell Abe he wants to deal with Josh alone.

Scissors: In a picture released by ITV, Liam can be seen passing a pair of scissors to a concerned-looking David, played by Jack P Shepherd

With help from Abe and Tez, David drags John to the top of a staircase.

Viewers will be left on a cliffhanger when David calls his fiancee Shona Ramsay, played by Julia Goulding, to tell her Josh has been stabbed.

He asks for a lawyer but the episode will not reveal whether it was actually David who killed his attacker.
